meanings.definition: A member of a council, especially a local government council.
meanings.sent1: The councillor attended the council meeting to discuss new policies.
meanings.sent2: The local councillor helped improve the community by fixing the playground.
meanings.sent3: The councillor joked that being on the council made them an expert in solving puzzles.
meanings.sent4: She was like a councillor in a chess game, strategically moving the pieces to achieve her goals.
meanings.sent5: The councillor, with their badge shining, stood out as a leader in the town hall.

meanings.definition: One who gives advice or guidance.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother is like a councillor to me, always offering wise words.
meanings.sent2: The therapist acted as a councillor, helping her patients navigate their emotions.
meanings.sent3: The councillor of fashion suggested pairing stripes with polka dots for a bold look.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was a councillor, guiding her to make the right decision in tough times.
meanings.sent5: The wise old tree seemed to be a councillor to the young saplings, sharing its knowledge of the seasons.
